33-year-old.context: The patient is a 33-year-old Caucasian male with a history of chronic hoarseness and bilateral true vocal cord lesions, and leukoplakia discovered on a fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy in the office.

bilateral true vocal cord lesions.context: The patient is a 33-year-old Caucasian male with a history of chronic hoarseness and bilateral true vocal cord lesions, and leukoplakia discovered on a fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy in the office.

leukoplakia.context: The areas of leukoplakia appeared to be cobblestoned in appearance, irregularly bordered, and very hard to the touch.

microscopic suspension direct laryngosco.context: Procedure Performed: Microscopic suspension direct laryngoscopy with biopsy of left true vocal cord stripping.

33-year-old Caucasian male.context: The patient is a 33-year-old Caucasian male with a history of chronic hoarseness and bilateral true vocal cord lesions, and leukoplakia discovered on a fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy in the office.

chronic hoarseness.context: The patient is a 33-year-old Caucasian male with a history of chronic hoarseness and bilateral true vocal cord lesions, and leukoplakia discovered on a fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy in the office.

fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy.context: The patient is a 33-year-old Caucasian male with a history of chronic hoarseness and bilateral true vocal cord lesions, and leukoplakia discovered on a fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy in the office.

10 mg of Decadron.context: The patient did receive intraoperatively 10 mg of Decadron.

Medrol DOSEPAK.context: The patient will be sent home with prescriptions for Medrol DOSEPAK, Tylenol with Codeine, Elixir, and amoxicillin 250 mg per 5 cc.

Tylenol with Codeine.context: The patient will be sent home with prescriptions for Medrol DOSEPAK, Tylenol with Codeine, Elixir, and amoxicillin 250 mg per 5 cc.

Elixir.context: The patient will be sent home with prescriptions for Medrol DOSEPAK, Tylenol with Codeine, Elixir, and amoxicillin 250 mg per 5 cc.

amoxicillin 250 mg per 5 cc.context: The patient will be sent home with prescriptions for Medrol DOSEPAK, Tylenol with Codeine, Elixir, and amoxicillin 250 mg per 5 cc.

shoulder roll.context: After this, the patient was placed under general endotracheal intubation anesthesia and the operative table was turned 90 degrees by the Department of Anesthesia. A shoulder roll was then placed followed by the patient being placed in reverse Trendelenburg.

reverse Trendelenburg.context: After this, the patient was placed under general endotracheal intubation anesthesia and the operative table was turned 90 degrees by the Department of Anesthesia. A shoulder roll was then placed followed by the patient being placed in reverse Trendelenburg.

mouthguard.context: After this, a mouthguard was placed in the upper teeth and a Dedo laryngoscope was placed in the patient's oral cavity and advanced through the oral cavity in the oropharynx down into the hypopharynx.

Dedo laryngoscope.context: After this, a mouthguard was placed in the upper teeth and a Dedo laryngoscope was placed in the patient's oral cavity and advanced through the oral cavity in the oropharynx down into the hypopharynx.

redundant false vocal cords.context: The patient's larynx was then brought into view with the true vocal cords hidden underneath what appeared to be redundant false vocal cords.

extensive area of leukoplakia.context: The left true vocal cord was then first addressed and appeared to have an extensive area of leukoplakia extending from the posterior one-third up to the anterior third.

false vocal cord.context: The false cord on the right side also appeared to be very redundant and overshadowing the true vocal cord.

subglottic region.context: The patient's subglottic region was very edematous and with redundant mucosal tissue.

anterior commissure.context: The patient's anterior commissure appeared to be clear.

true vocal cord.context: Once the true vocal cord was retracted laterally, there was revealed a second area of leukoplakia involving the right true vocal cord in the anterior one-third aspect.

#45 laryngeal forceps.context: The left true vocal cord was then first addressed, was stripped from posteriorly to anteriorly utilizing a #45 laryngeal forceps.

tropical adrenaline.context: After this, the patient had pressure placed upon this area with tropical adrenaline and a rectal swab to maintain hemostasis.

rectal swab.context: After this, the patient had pressure placed upon this area with tropical adrenaline and a rectal swab to maintain hemostasis.

Louie arm.context: Prior to taking this biopsy, the Louie arm was attached to the laryngoscope and then suspended on the Mayo stand.

Mayo stand.context: Prior to taking this biopsy, the Louie arm was attached to the laryngoscope and then suspended on the Mayo stand.

Zeiss operating microscope.context: The Zeiss operating microscope was then brought into view to directly visualize the vocal cords.

biopsy.context: The biopsies were taken under direct visualization utilizing the Zeiss operating microscope.

piriform sinuses.context: After the specimen was taken and the laryngoscope was desuspended from the Mayo stand and Louie arm was removed, the scope was then pulled more cephalad and the piriform sinuses, valecula, and base of the tongue were all directly visualized, which appeared normal except for the left base of tongue appeared to be full.

valecula.context: After the specimen was taken and the laryngoscope was desuspended from the Mayo stand and Louie arm was removed, the scope was then pulled more cephalad and the piriform sinuses, valecula, and base of the tongue were all directly visualized, which appeared normal except for the left base of tongue appeared to be full.

base of the tongue.context: After the specimen was taken and the laryngoscope was desuspended from the Mayo stand and Louie arm was removed, the scope was then pulled more cephalad and the piriform sinuses, valecula, and base of the tongue were all directly visualized, which appeared normal except for the left base of tongue appeared to be full.

straight laryngeal forceps.context: This area was biopsied multiple times with a straight laryngeal forceps and passed off the field and sent to Pathology as specimen.

oral cavity.context: The scope was then pulled back into the superior aspect of hypopharynx into the oropharynx and the oral cavity demonstrated no signs of any gross lesions.

bimanual examination.context: A bimanual examination was then performed, which again demonstrated a fullness on the left base of tongue region with no signs of any other gross lesions.

palpable cervical lymphadenopathy.context: There were no signs of any palpable cervical lymphadenopathy.

tooth guard.context: The tooth guard was removed and the patient was then turned back to anesthesia.
